 void setInvokeable(java.lang.String applicationName, boolean canBeInvoked)
          This tells the scatternet whether it should try to wake the application up.
 

Method Detail

setInvokeable

void setInvokeable(java.lang.String applicationName,
                   boolean canBeInvoked)
This tells the scatternet whether it should try to wake the application up. this is an optional feature, implementation depends on platform etc. This would be useful e.g. to start up some messaging application or online logger etc. set as true if the app behind the service string should be invokeable i.e. if you ever run quake the AR remembers, if someone asks the AR "does he have quake" the reply will be "yes but it's trned off" the AR could then send a request to the user, "do you want to run quake now?" need to think about what is spam, what should be allowed etc. default: false

Parameters:
applicationName -
canBeInvoked -
